verses.text_plain: And it came to pass, that when Isaac was old, and his eyes were dim, so that he could not see, he called Esau his eldest son, and said unto him, My son: and he said unto him, Behold, here am I.
verses.verse_html: 1And it came to pass, that when Isaac was old, and his eyes were dim, so that he could not see, he called Esau his eldest son, and said unto him, My son: and he said unto him, Behold, here am I.

tokens.text: so that he could not see

verses.text_plain: And he said, Behold now, I am old, I know not the day of my death:
verses.verse_html: 2And he said, Behold now, I am old, I know not the day of my death:

verses.text_plain: Now therefore take, I pray thee, thy weapons, thy quiver and thy bow, and go out to the field, and take me some venison;
verses.verse_html:
3Now therefore take, I pray thee, thy weapons, thy quiver and thy bow, and go out to the field, and take me some venison; ▼
▼ take: Heb. hunt

verses.text_plain: And make me savoury meat, such as I love, and bring it to me, that I may eat; that my soul may bless thee before I die.
verses.verse_html: 4And make me savoury meat, such as I love, and bring it to me, that I may eat; that my soul may bless thee before I die.

tokens.text: to me, that I may eat

verses.text_plain: And Rebekah heard when Isaac spake to Esau his son. And Esau went to the field to hunt for venison, and to bring it.
verses.verse_html: 5And Rebekah heard when Isaac spake to Esau his son. And Esau went to the field to hunt for venison, and to bring it.

verses.text_plain: And Rebekah spake unto Jacob her son, saying, Behold, I heard thy father speak unto Esau thy brother, saying,
verses.verse_html: 6And Rebekah spake unto Jacob her son, saying, Behold, I heard thy father speak unto Esau thy brother, saying,

verses.text_plain: Bring me venison, and make me savoury meat, that I may eat, and bless thee before the Lord before my death.
verses.verse_html: 7Bring me venison, and make me savoury meat, that I may eat, and bless thee before the Lord before my death.

verses.text_plain: Now therefore, my son, obey my voice according to that which I command thee.
verses.verse_html: 8Now therefore, my son, obey my voice according to that which I command thee.

verses.text_plain: Go now to the flock, and fetch me from thence two good kids of the goats; and I will make them savoury meat for thy father, such as he loveth:
verses.verse_html: 9Go now to the flock, and fetch me from thence two good kids of the goats; and I will make them savoury meat for thy father, such as he loveth:

verses.text_plain: And thou shalt bring it to thy father, that he may eat, and that he may bless thee before his death.
verses.verse_html: 10And thou shalt bring it to thy father, that he may eat, and that he may bless thee before his death.

verses.text_plain: And Jacob said to Rebekah his mother, Behold, Esau my brother is a hairy man, and I am a smooth man:
verses.verse_html: 11And Jacob said to Rebekah his mother, Behold, Esau my brother is a hairy man, and I am a smooth man:

verses.text_plain: My father peradventure will feel me, and I shall seem to him as a deceiver; and I shall bring a curse upon me, and not a blessing.
verses.verse_html: 12My father peradventure will feel me, and I shall seem to him as a deceiver; and I shall bring a curse upon me, and not a blessing.

tokens.text: upon me, and not a blessing

verses.text_plain: And his mother said unto him, Upon me be thy curse, my son: only obey my voice, and go fetch me them.
verses.verse_html: 13And his mother said unto him, Upon me be thy curse, my son: only obey my voice, and go fetch me them.

verses.text_plain: And he went, and fetched, and brought them to his mother: and his mother made savoury meat, such as his father loved.
verses.verse_html: 14And he went, and fetched, and brought them to his mother: and his mother made savoury meat, such as his father loved.

verses.text_plain: And Rebekah took goodly raiment of her eldest son Esau, which were with her in the house, and put them upon Jacob her younger son:
verses.verse_html:
15And Rebekah took goodly raiment of her eldest son Esau, which were with her in the house, and put them upon Jacob her younger son: ▼
▼ goodly: Heb. desirable

verses.text_plain: And she put the skins of the kids of the goats upon his hands, and upon the smooth of his neck:
verses.verse_html: 16And she put the skins of the kids of the goats upon his hands, and upon the smooth of his neck:

verses.text_plain: And she gave the savoury meat and the bread, which she had prepared, into the hand of her son Jacob.
verses.verse_html: 17And she gave the savoury meat and the bread, which she had prepared, into the hand of her son Jacob.

verses.text_plain: And he came unto his father, and said, My father: and he said, Here am I; who art thou, my son?
verses.verse_html: 18And he came unto his father, and said, My father: and he said, Here am I; who art thou, my son?

verses.text_plain: And Jacob said unto his father, I am Esau thy firstborn; I have done according as thou badest me: arise, I pray thee, sit and eat of my venison, that thy soul may bless me.
verses.verse_html: 19And Jacob said unto his father, I am Esau thy firstborn; I have done according as thou badest me: arise, I pray thee, sit and eat of my venison, that thy soul may bless me.

verses.text_plain: And Isaac said unto his son, How is it that thou hast found it so quickly, my son? And he said, Because the Lord thy God brought it to me.
verses.verse_html:
20And Isaac said unto his son, How is it that thou hast found it so quickly, my son? And he said, Because the Lord thy God brought it to me. ▼
▼ to me: Heb. before me

footnotes.body_html: ▼ to me: Heb. before me

verses.text_plain: And Isaac said unto Jacob, Come near, I pray thee, that I may feel thee, my son, whether thou be my very son Esau or not.
verses.verse_html: 21And Isaac said unto Jacob, Come near, I pray thee, that I may feel thee, my son, whether thou be my very son Esau or not.

tokens.text: I pray thee, that I may feel

verses.text_plain: And Jacob went near unto Isaac his father; and he felt him, and said, The voice is Jacob’s voice, but the hands are the hands of Esau.
verses.verse_html: 22And Jacob went near unto Isaac his father; and he felt him, and said, The voice is Jacob’s voice, but the hands are the hands of Esau.

verses.text_plain: And he discerned him not, because his hands were hairy, as his brother Esau’s hands: so he blessed him.
verses.verse_html: 23And he discerned him not, because his hands were hairy, as his brother Esau’s hands: so he blessed him.

verses.text_plain: And he said, Art thou my very son Esau? And he said, I am.
verses.verse_html: 24And he said, Art thou my very son Esau? And he said, I am.

verses.text_plain: And he said, Bring it near to me, and I will eat of my son’s venison, that my soul may bless thee. And he brought it near to him, and he did eat: and he brought him wine, and he drank.
verses.verse_html: 25And he said, Bring it near to me, and I will eat of my son’s venison, that my soul may bless thee. And he brought it near to him, and he did eat: and he brought him wine, and he drank.

tokens.text: to me, and I will eat
to him, and he did eat

verses.text_plain: And his father Isaac said unto him, Come near now, and kiss me, my son.
verses.verse_html: 26And his father Isaac said unto him, Come near now, and kiss me, my son.

verses.text_plain: And he came near, and kissed him: and he smelled the smell of his raiment, and blessed him, and said, See, the smell of my son is as the smell of a field which the Lord hath blessed:
verses.verse_html: 27And he came near, and kissed him: and he smelled the smell of his raiment, and blessed him, and said, See, the smell of my son is as the smell of a field which the Lord hath blessed:

verses.text_plain: Therefore God give thee of the dew of heaven, and the fatness of the earth, and plenty of corn and wine:
verses.verse_html: 28Therefore God give thee of the dew of heaven, and the fatness of the earth, and plenty of corn and wine:

verses.text_plain: Let people serve thee, and nations bow down to thee: be lord over thy brethren, and let thy mother’s sons bow down to thee: cursed be every one that curseth thee, and blessed be he that blesseth thee.
verses.verse_html: 29Let people serve thee, and nations bow down to thee: be lord over thy brethren, and let thy mother’s sons bow down to thee: cursed be every one that curseth thee, and blessed be he that blesseth thee.

verses.text_plain: And it came to pass, as soon as Isaac had made an end of blessing Jacob, and Jacob was yet scarce gone out from the presence of Isaac his father, that Esau his brother came in from his hunting.
verses.verse_html: 30And it came to pass, as soon as Isaac had made an end of blessing Jacob, and Jacob was yet scarce gone out from the presence of Isaac his father, that Esau his brother came in from his hunting.

tokens.text: And it came to pass, as soon as Isaac

verses.text_plain: And he also had made savoury meat, and brought it unto his father, and said unto his father, Let my father arise, and eat of his son’s venison, that thy soul may bless me.
verses.verse_html: 31And he also had made savoury meat, and brought it unto his father, and said unto his father, Let my father arise, and eat of his son’s venison, that thy soul may bless me.

verses.text_plain: And Isaac his father said unto him, Who art thou? And he said, I am thy son, thy firstborn Esau.
verses.verse_html: 32And Isaac his father said unto him, Who art thou? And he said, I am thy son, thy firstborn Esau.

verses.text_plain: And Isaac trembled very exceedingly, and said, Who? where is he that hath taken venison, and brought it me, and I have eaten of all before thou camest, and have blessed him? yea, and he shall be blessed.
verses.verse_html:
33And Isaac trembled very exceedingly, and said, Who? where is he that hath taken venison, and brought it me, and I have eaten of all before thou camest, and have blessed him? yea, and he shall be blessed. ▼
▼ trembled…: Heb. trembled with a great trembling greatly
 , ▼
▼ taken: Heb. hunted

footnotes.body_text: ▼ trembled…: Heb. trembled with a great trembling greatly
footnotes.body_html: ▼ trembled…: Heb. trembled with a great trembling greatly

verses.text_plain: And when Esau heard the words of his father, he cried with a great and exceeding bitter cry, and said unto his father, Bless me, even me also, O my father.
verses.verse_html: 34And when Esau heard the words of his father, he cried with a great and exceeding bitter cry, and said unto his father, Bless me, even me also, O my father.

verses.text_plain: And he said, Thy brother came with subtilty, and hath taken away thy blessing.
verses.verse_html: 35And he said, Thy brother came with subtilty, and hath taken away thy blessing.

verses.text_plain: And he said, Is not he rightly named Jacob? for he hath supplanted me these two times: he took away my birthright; and, behold, now he hath taken away my blessing. And he said, Hast thou not reserved a blessing for me?
verses.verse_html:
36And he said, Is not he rightly named Jacob? for he hath supplanted me these two times: he took away my birthright; and, behold, now he hath taken away my blessing. And he said, Hast thou not reserved a blessing for me? ▼
▼ Jacob: that is, A supplanter

tokens.text: and, behold, now he hath taken away

footnotes.body_html: ▼ Jacob: that is, A supplanter

verses.text_plain: And Isaac answered and said unto Esau, Behold, I have made him thy lord, and all his brethren have I given to him for servants; and with corn and wine have I sustained him: and what shall I do now unto thee, my son?
verses.verse_html:
37And Isaac answered and said unto Esau, Behold, I have made him thy lord, and all his brethren have I given to him for servants; and with corn and wine have I sustained him: and what shall I do now unto thee, my son? ▼
▼ sustained: or, supported

tokens.text: him: and what shall I do

verses.text_plain: And Esau said unto his father, Hast thou but one blessing, my father? bless me, even me also, O my father. And Esau lifted up his voice, and wept.
verses.verse_html: 38And Esau said unto his father, Hast thou but one blessing, my father? bless me, even me also, O my father. And Esau lifted up his voice, and wept.

verses.text_plain: And Isaac his father answered and said unto him, Behold, thy dwelling shall be the fatness of the earth, and of the dew of heaven from above;
verses.verse_html:
39And Isaac his father answered and said unto him, Behold, thy dwelling shall be the fatness of the earth, and of the dew of heaven from above; ▼
▼ the fatness: or, of the fatness

footnotes.body_text: ▼ the fatness: or, of the fatness
footnotes.body_html: ▼ the fatness: or, of the fatness

verses.text_plain: And by thy sword shalt thou live, and shalt serve thy brother; and it shall come to pass when thou shalt have the dominion, that thou shalt break his yoke from off thy neck.
verses.verse_html: 40And by thy sword shalt thou live, and shalt serve thy brother; and it shall come to pass when thou shalt have the dominion, that thou shalt break his yoke from off thy neck.

tokens.text: and it shall come to pass when thou shalt have the dominion

verses.text_plain: And Esau hated Jacob because of the blessing wherewith his father blessed him: and Esau said in his heart, The days of mourning for my father are at hand; then will I slay my brother Jacob.
verses.verse_html: 41And Esau hated Jacob because of the blessing wherewith his father blessed him: and Esau said in his heart, The days of mourning for my father are at hand; then will I slay my brother Jacob.

verses.text_plain: And these words of Esau her elder son were told to Rebekah: and she sent and called Jacob her younger son, and said unto him, Behold, thy brother Esau, as touching thee, doth comfort himself, purposing to kill thee.
verses.verse_html: 42And these words of Esau her elder son were told to Rebekah: and she sent and called Jacob her younger son, and said unto him, Behold, thy brother Esau, as touching thee, doth comfort himself, purposing to kill thee.

verses.text_plain: Now therefore, my son, obey my voice; and arise, flee thou to Laban my brother to Haran;
verses.verse_html: 43Now therefore, my son, obey my voice; and arise, flee thou to Laban my brother to Haran;

verses.text_plain: And tarry with him a few days, until thy brother’s fury turn away;
verses.verse_html: 44And tarry with him a few days, until thy brother’s fury turn away;

verses.text_plain: Until thy brother’s anger turn away from thee, and he forget that which thou hast done to him: then I will send, and fetch thee from thence: why should I be deprived also of you both in one day?
verses.verse_html: 45Until thy brother’s anger turn away from thee, and he forget that which thou hast done to him: then I will send, and fetch thee from thence: why should I be deprived also of you both in one day?

tokens.text: to him: then I will send

verses.text_plain: And Rebekah said to Isaac, I am weary of my life because of the daughters of Heth: if Jacob take a wife of the daughters of Heth, such as these which are of the daughters of the land, what good shall my life do me?
verses.verse_html: 46And Rebekah said to Isaac, I am weary of my life because of the daughters of Heth: if Jacob take a wife of the daughters of Heth, such as these which are of the daughters of the land, what good shall my life do me?
